I found it very hard to deal with. Mark had a breakdown when he was 18.
The old brother had this problem.
He was our problem and family, Mon, Dad, Police did not know what to do with him.
There are more than 100,000 people with schizophrenia in Australia. Yet the illness really features in the Media.
"Mom and Dad had to put up with it for another 20 years.
We weren't able to escape because nobody knew how to deal with this issue."
Schizophrenia is a biological disease of the brain which permanently disables more young people
than any other illness. Yet it receives far less public attention than any other serious disease.
Schizophrenia often appears during teenage years and causes 10% of the patients to commit suicide.
This accounts for a grater number of deaths than from aids, Multiple sclerosis and melanoma combined.
Yet, no nation wide public awareness campaign has ever appeared.
90% of cases arise in families with no previous history of mental illness so every child is at risk.
Sooner or later one in every 100 children will be diagnosed with schizophrenia.
Many patients refuse to take medication which makes it difficult for their families to take care of them at home.
This is also why around 25% of street people in our cities are Schizophrenia patients.
"In this country hundreds more people have been diagnosed with schizophrenia every year.
We don't know how to take it before happens how to cure it after it happens.
The only long term answer is to find a way to prevent it and cure it and that is what NISAD
The Neuro Science institute of Schizophrenia and Allied Disorders is all about.
"Nisad has developed a new concept in scientific research. We aren't all located in one building.
We are a virtual institute.
This means we work with the most talented scientists internations throughout Australia and around the world.
Our vision is to discover the causes of Schizophrenia and we use a range of multi facetted approaches.
Our researches use a lot of different methods as you will see.
"We've shown for the first time that the reception for a particular chemical within the brain
is altered in the frontal lobs of the brain in schizophrenia.
With more research into why these dangers occur we had to go on a better understanding into
what causes schizophrenia which is essential for the development of better treatments in the future.-->
